controllers

Class MainController

  • Object
    • MainController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewControllerListener

    public class MainController
extends Object
implements ViewControllerListener
    The main controller acts as presenter passing model data to GUI, passing GUI events to model, and actioning events up to the final save or render
    Author:
    Tony

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        The move up button in the GUI must switch the position in the playlist of the selected item, with the item above it in the list. It must also update the chart numbers that display onscreen
        Specified by:
        moveUp in interface ViewControllerListener

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        The move down button in the GUI must switch the postion in the playlist of the selected item, with the item below it in the list. It must also update the chart numbers that display onscreen
        Specified by:
        moveDown in interface ViewControllerListener

      • loadPlaylist

        public void loadPlaylist()
                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                         IOException,
                         MediaOpenException
        Load playlist must be above to clear the current GUI's list and populate it from the XML file that is selected by the user, and populate all the additional GUI fields
        Specified by:
        loadPlaylist in interface ViewControllerListener
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException
        MediaOpenException

      • savePlaylist

        public void savePlaylist()
                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                         IOException
        To save a playlist we must take changes from the GUI and ensure they are in the playlist object, we check the chart positions defensively, and we ensure User has at least set a theme (faults default to values so are of secondary concern). We then serialise the result to a file the user chooses
        Specified by:
        savePlaylist in interface ViewControllerListener
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException

      • render

        public void render()
            throws IOException,
                   MediaOpenException,
                   NullPointerException
        Rendering a playlist means to composite all the choices the user has made as a media file on disk. So Render will take all the choices, check what it can and then call the media implementation to render if all is ok
        Specified by:
        render in interface ViewControllerListener
        Throws:
        IOException
        MediaOpenException
        NullPointerException

      • createWorker

        public Task<?> createWorker(Theme theme,
                   File file,
                   String outFileUNC)
        Actually renders the final result and displays the finshed produce in a window
        Parameters:
        theme - the selected Theme
        file - the file reference the user has chosen
        outFileUNC - the path as string
        Returns:
        true if successful, will also play result in a window

      • reFindPlaylistEntry

        public void reFindPlaylistEntry(int pos)
                         throws MediaOpenException
        If a playlist entry has to be refound by the user because it has a problem, we will re-validate that entry, and if it is ok, we will replace the problem entry
